name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In fact, if you think about it carefully, why do people lock you up at home and let you starve? Because your life is not important to them. If he lets you live a normal life and you get infected, then he has violated Xi Jinping's zero-COVID policy and he will lose his job. Whether you think China's epidemic prevention policy is good or not, you must understand that your life is not as important as the official's job, which is the fundamental reason why all places insist on locking you up at home. Making money is just a by-product.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
So it's useless for you to say that you are starving to death and can't live anymore. People don't care about these things at all. As long as you don't die from the new coronavirus, it's a great victory for them.
Only if you make a big fuss, and make it bigger than epidemic prevention and affect his official hat, will he look at you straight in the eye.
Why does he want to prevent your three generations from taking the civil service exam if you make a fuss? Because he is really afraid of you making a fuss.

content:
I understand. As long as I intervene, the contradiction of this matter changes from "something I should face myself" to "why do you encourage me to fight?"
The problem is that it is you who is being sealed off and starving, not me. If you yourself are unwilling to fight, do you want me to fly back to fight for you?
Since this is the land where you live, you should fight for your rights. If this is meaningless, then you deserve to be sealed off.
